sentences.text: Proxy Overview
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This overview highlights information contained elsewhere in the proxy statement and  does not contain all of the information that you should consider.

sentences.text: AN ACTIVE & ENGAGED  BOARD
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Refreshed Board, recruiting  4 directors & retiring 3
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Oversaw significant portfolio shifts: Baker Hughes and GE  Digital & Additive
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q&A WITH OUR LEAD DIRECTOR
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: our investors were in the Boards discussions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We think about a number of stakeholders,  but a key question for us is how our decisions  impact the owners of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Can you discuss the Boards role   in the strategic planning process?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adopted director term limit  of 15 years  Implemented proxy access
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One of the Boards key roles is overseeing  strategy, for which we use an annual rhythm  that starts in mid-summer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board does a  deep dive, working closely in small groups with  executives of varying seniority.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The output of  these sessions provides the strategic context  for the Boards discussions at its meetings  throughout the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are several ways in which the Board  receives investor feedback.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our IR and  governance teams are on the front lines engaging  with shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Throughout the year, they  have 1,000+ investor engagements, including  150+ meetings with senior management, and  provide feedback to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Redesigned cash & equity  incentive compensation  programs  Eliminated dividend  equivalents on unvested RSUs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also hears directly from investors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Two years ago, we began a process of inviting  major shareowners into the boardroom to meet  in executive session with the independent  directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We listen to their views on strategy,  business and financial issues, including what  we are doing well and areas for improvement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, in my role as lead director, I am  available to our large investors and have had  the opportunity to engage with several of them  on governance and compensation matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While we have a multi-year strategic plan, we  also realize that in todays environment we  need to be nimble and opportunistic, adjusting  strategy as the world around us changes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This  requires a lot of Board meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example,  we met as a Board 13 times last year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BOARD ACCOUNTABILITY  TO INVESTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual director elections with  majority voting standard
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Large capital allocation decisions are typically  the product of an iterative Board discussion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, one of the most important things  we did in 2016 was announce our planned  combination of GE Oil & Gas with Baker Hughes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This was the result of discussions over the  course of 10 meetings in which we engaged on  the risks and opportunities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy access at 3%, 3 years,  20% of Board, up to 20  shareowners can aggregate
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How do GEs executive pay   plans fit together and connect  to GEs strategy?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Board governance  review that includes investor  views & feedback
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An important focus area for the Board is  executive pay and ensuring that the structure  provides the right incentives for our leaders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We  have 3 main performance-based compensation plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: First, we have an annual cash bonus  plan, in which approximately 5,000 executives  participate, and which aligns with our annual  investor framework.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is a relatively new  plan at GE, but so far has been a tremendous  cultural enhancement to drive accountability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also have a long-term cash incentive plan  (our LTPAs), in which ~1,000 senior executives  participate, and which aligns with our 3-year  operating plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is important for ensuring  that our leaders do not simply focus on annual  results, but are managing the company for the  long term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lastly, we have a performance-based equity plan (our PSUs), in which <25 of our most senior officers participate, and which helps  drive relative stock price outperformance over a 3-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How does the Board approach  director recruitment?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Periodic independent director  meetings with investors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board recruitment is a topic that is front and  center with investors today and, as a Board, we  spend a lot of time on it.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over the last five years, we have refreshed more than half of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: INDEPENDENT BOARD  LEADERSHIP
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In looking for candidates, we start with character,  seeking candidates with the highest standards,  who are committed to upholding GEs values  and who will be independent, strong stewards  of our investors capital.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Then, as we go  through the process of assessing future Board  recruitment needs, we look to recruit candidates  from different backgrounds so that they can  contribute to the cognitive diversity on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3X+/year meetings in executive session  without management present
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2X+/year visits to GE businesses by  each director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is an ongoing endeavor for us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We of course  take a long-term look at the refreshment that  is expected to occur over time as a result of  our term limit and age limit policies, but we are  always looking for new directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is vitally  important that we continue to have the right  skill sets on the Board as GEs portfolio and  strategy change.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 30+ committee meetings in 2016   (all committees are independent)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How We Build a Board That Is Right for GE

sentences.text: DIRECTOR SINCE: 2010  AGE: 64  BIRTHPLACE:   UNITED STATES  INDEPENDENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that GE benefits by fostering a mix of experienced directors with a deep understanding  of the companys industries and technologies and who bring fresh perspectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance &  Public Affairs Committee (the Governance Committee) is charged with reviewing the composition  of the Board and refreshing it as appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With this in mind, the committee continuously  reviews potential candidates and recommends nominees to the Board for approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because GE is considered a very desirable Board, we are able to recruit exceptionally talented  directors on an ongoing basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this regard, the committee has recruited 10 new directors to the  Board over the past five years, including two new directors since the 2016 annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IMPORTANT FACTORS IN ASSESSING BOARD COMPOSITION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee strives to maintain an engaged, independent board with broad and  diverse experience and judgment that is committed to representing the long-term interests of  our shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee considers a wide range of factors when selecting and recruiting  director candidates, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that directors who have held significant leadership positions over an  extended period, especially CEO positions, possess extraordinary leadership qualities  and demonstrate a practical understanding of organizations, processes, strategy and risk  management, and know how to drive change and growth.

sentences.text: For example,  approximately 57% of our revenues and 62% of our infrastructure orders came from  outside the US in 2016.

sentences.text: For example, over the last few years we have added directors with  oil and gas and healthcare industry experience given the significance of our Oil & Gas and  Healthcare businesses, which comprise 10% and 15% of our revenues, respectively.

sentences.text: Technology experience has become increasingly important as we  intensify our focus on software and the Industrial Internet with the launch of GE Digital.

sentences.text: BOARD PRIORITIES GOING FORWARD
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RISK MANAGEMENT EXPERIENCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In light of the Boards role in overseeing risk management and understanding the most  significant risks facing the company, we have added directors with experience in risk  management and oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the Boards risk management focus shifts from financial  services to industrial and product risk (as reflected in our committee structure changes),  we expect to calibrate our future recruitment priorities accordingly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continuing to ensure a cognitively diverse  Board, with the following priorities:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GOVERNMENT EXPERIENCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have added directors with experience in governmental and regulatory organizations because many of GEs businesses are heavily regulated and are directly affected by  governmental actions and socioeconomic trends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HOW YOU CAN RECOMMEND  A CANDIDATE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MARKETING EXPERIENCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Write to the Governance Committee,  c/o Alex Dimitrief, Secretary, GE, at the  address listed on the inside front cover  of this proxy statement, and include all  information that our by-laws require  for director nominations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The general  qualifications and specific qualities  and skills sought by the committee for  directors are discussed under How We Build a Board That Is Right for GE on  page 18.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GE seeks to grow organically by identifying and developing new markets for its products and services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors with marketing expertise, especially on an international scale,   are therefore important to us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Marketing and branding expertise is also important as we shift our portfolio to be more industrial and software focused.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Enhancing the Boards diversity of background.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board does not have a formal diversity  policy, but the Governance Committee takes into account a candidates ability to contribute  to the cognitive diversity of backgrounds on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To this end, we consider attributes  such as race, ethnicity, gender, age, cultural background and professional experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  committee reviews its effectiveness in balancing these considerations when assessing  the composition of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Complying with regulatory requirements and the Boards independence guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  committee considers regulatory requirements affecting directors, including potential  competitive restrictions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It also looks at other positions the director has held or holds  (including other board memberships), and the Board reviews director independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HOW WE REFRESH THE BOARD
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Term limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has a   15-year term limit for independent  directors (with a 2-year transition period  for existing directors).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CANDIDATE RECOMMENDATIONS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee considers all shareowner recommendations  for director candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We evaluate them in the same manner as candidates suggested by other  directors and candidates suggested by third-party search firms (which the company retains  from time to time, and has retained over the past year, to help identify potential candidates).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Mollenkopf and Dr. LavizzoMourey were initially recommended to the Governance Committee  by a third-party search firm and an independent director, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Age limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With limited exceptions,  directors may not be renominated   to the Board after their 75th birthday.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board evaluation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the   Board assesses its effectiveness   through a process led by its lead   director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See How We Evaluate the  Boards Effectiveness on page 23.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How We Assess Board Size
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee takes a fresh look at Board size each year, consistent with the  Boards Governance Principles (see Helpful Resources on page 81).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee believes  that the proposed size of the Board (18 directors), while large, is appropriate in view of the size  of GE and the diversity and complexity of the businesses and markets in which we operate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  committee also expects to reduce the size of the Board as incumbent directors transition off  the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, the committee expects that Andrea Jung (our longest-tenured director)  will not be renominated in 2018 and that Shelly Lazarus (our next longest-tenured director) will  not be renominated in 2019.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following these final transitions under the Boards term limit policy,  which we believe will ensure Board continuity, we do not expect that any other director will be  allowed to serve on the Board for more than 15 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See the Boards Governance Principles (see Helpful  Resources on page 81) for more information on  these policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How We Assess Director Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BOARD MEMBERS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards Governance Principles require all non-  management directors to be independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our director nominees  (listed under Election of Directors on page 12) other than Mr. Immelt  are independent, as were former directors James I. Cash, Jr., Robert J.  Swieringa and Douglas A. Warner III throughout the period they served  on our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMMITTEE MEMBERS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All members of the Audit Committee,  Management Development and Compensation Committee (the  Compensation Committee), and Governance Committee must be  independent, as defined by the Boards Governance Principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some  committee members must also meet additional standards:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Heightened standards for Audit Committee members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under a separate SEC independence requirement, Audit Committee  members may not accept any consulting, advisory or other fees  from GE or any of its subsidiaries, except compensation for  Board service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a director to be considered  independent, the Board must determine that he or she does not  have any material relationship with GE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards guidelines for  director independence conform to, and in some ways are more  exacting than, the independence requirements in the New York  Stock Exchanges (NYSE) listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to applying  these guidelines, which you can find in the Boards Governance  Principles on GEs website (see Helpful Resources on page 81),  the Board considers all relevant facts and circumstances when  making an independence determination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Heightened standards for members of the Compensation  and Governance Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a policy matter, the Board  also applies a separate, heightened independence standard to  members of the Compensation and Governance Committees:  no member of either committee may be a partner, member or  principal of a law firm, accounting firm or investment banking firm  that accepts consulting or advisory fees from GE or a subsidiary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, in determining that Compensation Committee  members are independent, NYSE rules require the Board to  consider their sources of compensation, including any consulting,  advisory or other compensation paid by GE or a subsidiary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Applying the guidelines in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In assessing director  independence for 2016, the Board considered relevant  transactions, relationships and arrangements, including  relationships among Board members, their family members and  the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For details, see Relationships and Transactions  Considered for Director Independence below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that all members of the Audit,  Compensation and Governance Committees as well as the  Technology & Industrial Risk Committee (the Industrial Risk  Committee) are independent and also satisfy any committee-specific  independence requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How We Evaluate the Boards  Effectiveness
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GE PRACTICE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage our directors to meet with GE senior  managers throughout the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To facilitate this contact, directors  are expected to make at least two visits to GE businesses each year,  typically unaccompanied by corporate management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Priority goes  to those businesses identified as strategically important during the  companys annual financial and strategic planning sessions as well  as any that were recently acquired or are a particular focus of risk  oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These visits also serve as an important tool in the Boards  succession planning process for the CEO and the rest of the senior  leadership team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ANNUAL EVALUATION PROCESS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the lead director  interviews each director to obtain his or her assessment of director  performance, Board dynamics and the effectiveness of the Board and  its committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The interview focuses on:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Improving issue prioritization
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Enhancing the quality of written materials and oral presentations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Assessing how Board matters from the past year could have   been handled better
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Identifying specific issues to be discussed in future  Board meetings
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At times, directors may also complete written assessments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After  consulting with the chair of the Governance Committee, the lead  director summarizes the directors assessments for discussion  with the Board and committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From time to time, we engage an  independent, third-party governance expert to conduct the interviews.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information on this evaluation process, see the Boards  Governance Principles and the Governance Committees Key Practices  (see Helpful Resources on page 81).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BOARD LEADERSHIP STRUCTURE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO serves as the chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An independent  director serves as the Boards lead director, with broad authority and  responsibility over Board governance and operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CHAIRMAN OF   THE BOARD & CEO LEAD DIRECTOR ELECTED SOLELY  BY INDEPENDENT DIRECTORS INDEPENDENT DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WHY OUR BOARD LEADERSHIP STRUCTURE IS APPROPRIATE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR GE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board periodically reviews its leadership structure to  determine whether it remains appropriate for the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe  that our present structure allows our CEO to speak for and lead both  GE and the Board and to focus the independent directors attention on  the issues of greatest importance to the company and its shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A strong independent lead director ensures effective and independent  Board oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HOW WE SELECT THE LEAD DIRECTOR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HOW WE SELECT THE LEAD DIRECTOR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance  Committee considers feedback from the current lead director, our  Board members and the chairman, and then makes a recommendation to the Boards independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Acting on this recommendation,  the independent directors elect the lead director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Jack Brennan, chair  emeritus of the Vanguard Group, was elected as the lead director  in 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Boards Governance Principles, Mr. Brennan also  serves as chair of the Compensation Committee and as a member of  the Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of Mr. Brennans incapacity,  the chair of the Governance Committee would serve as the lead  director until the independent directors selected a new lead director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION  COMMITTEE CHAIR GOVERNANCE  COMMITTEE MEMBER LEAD DIRECTOR ALSO SERVES AS:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE LEAD DIRECTORS ROLE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The lead director focuses on  optimizing the Boards processes and ensuring that it is prioritizing  the right matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, the lead director has the following  responsibilities (and may also perform other functions at the Boards request), as detailed in the Boards Governance Principles:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board leadership   provides leadership to the Board in any  situation where the chairmans role may be perceived to be in  conflict, and chairs meetings when the chairman is absent
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leadership of independent director meetings   leads  independent director meetings, which are scheduled at least  three times per year (in addition to the numerous informal  sessions that occur throughout the year) without any  management directors or GE employees present
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board governance processes   works with the Governance  Committee to guide the Boards governance processes, including  succession planning and the annual Board self-evaluation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board leadership structure review   oversees the Boards  periodic review and evaluation of its leadership structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional meetings   calls additional Board or independent  director meetings as needed
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chairman evaluation   leads annual chairman evaluation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committee chair selection   advises the Governance  Committee in choosing committee chairs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chairman-independent director liaison   regularly meets with  the chairman and serves as liaison between the chairman and the  independent directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareowner communications   makes himself/herself available  for direct communication with our major shareowners
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board priorities   works with the chairman to propose an annual schedule of major Board discussion items
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board agenda, schedule & information   approves the agenda,  schedule and information sent to directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: STRATEGY AND BUSINESS MATTERS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2015, the company began  inviting major institutional investors to meet periodically with GEs  independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This complements managements investor  outreach program and allows directors to directly solicit and receive  investors views on GEs strategy and performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016, the lead director regularly accompanies management on its  governance-focused roadshow with select investors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ANNUAL SHAREOWNERS MEETING
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How We Incorporated Investor  Feedback Over the Past Year
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Investor Outreach and Our 2016  Say-On-Pay Vote
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, we sought feedback from investors on a number of issues,  and the Board decided to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2016 annual meeting, shareowners expressed a high level  of support (94%) for the compensation of our named executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following the meeting, we met with our largest investors to review  compensation actions for the past year and discuss our say-on- pay vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Enhance our proxy disclosures, including providing more  explanation for why we pay each element of compensation  (see Primary Compensation Elements for 2016 on page 31)  and adding more disclosure around changes in our incentive  compensation performance metrics and targets from the prior  year (see Aligning Pay with Performance on page 6); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of its assessment of GEs executive compensation programs,  the Compensation Committee reviewed these voting results,  evaluated investor feedback and considered other factors discussed  in this proxy statement, including the alignment of our compensation  program with the long-term interests of our shareowners and the  relationship between risk-taking and the incentive compensation we  provide to our named executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Strengthen our director overboarding policy by adding a  prohibition on our lead director serving as the lead director,  chairman of the board or CEO of another public company (see  Limits on Director Service on Other Public Boards on page 27)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After considering these factors, as well as the significant changes  made to both our cash and equity incentive compensation programs  in 2015, the committee reaffirmed the elements of our executive  compensation program and policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HOW YOU CAN COMMUNICATE WITH YOUR BOARD
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee and the independent directors have  established procedures to enable anyone who has a comment  or concern about GEs conduct   including any employee  who has a concern about our accounting, internal accounting  controls or auditing matters   to communicate that comment or  concern directly to the lead director or to the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information on how to submit these comments or concerns can  be found on GEs website (see Helpful Resources on page 81).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Governance Policies & Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HOW WE APPLIED TO TISCH.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board determined to waive the  first limitation for Mr. Tisch, who is CEO of Loews, because the three  other public company boards on which he serves are all within Loewss  consolidated group of companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Loews is a diversified holding  company whose business operations are entirely conducted through  its subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Two of these subsidiaries, CNA Financial (90% owned)  and Diamond Offshore Drilling (53% owned), accounted for more than  85% of Loewss revenues over the past three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Tisch serves  on the boards of these subsidiaries and on the holding companys  board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since Mr. Tischs responsibilities as a board member of these  companies are integrally related to and subsumed within his role as  CEO of Loews, the Board believes that this board service does not  meaningfully increase his time commitments or fiduciary duties, as  would be the case with service on unaffiliated public company boards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Attendance at Meetings
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board expects directors to attend all meetings of the Board and  the committees on which the director serves as well as the annual  shareowners meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BOARD/COMMITTEE MEETINGS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, each of our director  nominees and current directors attended at least 75% of the meetings  held by the Board and committees on which the member served during the period the member was on the Board or committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ANNUAL SHAREOWNERS MEETING.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 13 out of 16 director nominees  for 2016 attended the 2016 annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HOW WE APPLIED TO BAZIN.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Bazin serves on a total of three  public company boards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, he serves on two of the boards  in connection with his role as CEO of AccorHotels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He serves on the  boards of Accor and China Lodging Group, which have entered into a  strategic alliance pursuant to which China Lodging Group is the master  franchiser for Accors economy hotel business in China and owns a  29% stake in Accors luxury and upscale operating platform in China,  and Accor owns an 11% stake in China Lodging Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CODE OF CONDUCT.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All directors, officers and employees of GE must act ethically at all times and in accordance with GEs code of conduct  (contained in the companys integrity policy, The Spirit & The Letter).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Boards Governance Principles, the Board does not permit  any waiver of any ethics policy for any director or executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Spirit & The Letter, and any amendments to the code that we are  required to disclose under SEC rules, are posted on GEs website (see  Helpful Resources on page 81).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent Oversight of  Political Spending
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CONFLICTS OF INTEREST.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All directors are required to recuse  themselves from any discussion or decision affecting their personal,  business or professional interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an actual or potential conflict of  interest arises, the director is required to promptly inform the CEO  and the lead director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee reviews any such  conflict of interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any significant conflict cannot be resolved, the  director involved is expected to resign.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee, composed solely of independent  directors, oversees the companys political spending and lobbying.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This includes political and campaign contributions as well as any  contributions to trade associations and other tax-exempt and similar  organizations that may engage in political activity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of its  oversight role in public policy and corporate social responsibility, the  committee is responsible for the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Limits on Director Service on Other  Public Boards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Policy oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A yearly review of GEs political spending  policies and lobbying practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GE POLICY.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed in detail in the Boards governance  documents and summarized in the table below, the Board has adopted  policies to ensure that all of our directors have sufficient time to  devote to GE matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Budget oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approval of GEs annual budget for political  activities and a semi-annual review of how it is being spent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Issuance of a yearly report on the companys political  spending, which is available on our Sustainability website (see  Helpful Resources on page 81).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Permitted # of public company boards  (including GE) Public company CEOs 3 Other directors 5   Permitted # of public company   audit committees (including GE) Audit Committee Chair 2 Audit Committee member 3   Other restrictions Lead Director Cant serve as lead director, chairman   or CEO of another public company
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RECONSIDERING GES LOBBYING STRATEGY.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In light of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: developments over the past several years on policies that are critical  to the success of GE and the ongoing changes in the dynamics of  elections, the company is continuing a comprehensive review of our  policies on lobbying and campaign contributions to ensure that we are  appropriately advancing and safeguarding GEs business interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HOW YOU CAN FIND MORE INFORMATION ABOUT  OUR GOVERNANCE PRACTICES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year we review GEs governance documents and modify  them as appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These documents include the Boards  Governance Principles   which include our director qualifications  and director independence guidelines   as well as Board  committee charters and key practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The web links for these  materials can be found under Helpful Resources on page 81,  and you can receive copies upon request.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GE 2017 Proxy Statement Governance  Other Governance Policies & Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Related Person Transactions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HOW WE REVIEW AND APPROVE TRANSACTIONS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We review all  relationships and transactions in which the company and our directors  and executive officers or their immediate family members participate  if the amount involved exceeds $120,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of this review is  to determine whether they have a material interest in the transaction,  including an indirect interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The companys legal staff is primarily  responsible for making these determinations based on the facts and  circumstances, and for developing and implementing processes and  controls for obtaining information about these transactions from  directors and executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As SEC rules require, we disclose in  this proxy statement all such transactions that are determined to  be directly or indirectly material to a related person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the  Governance Committee reviews and approves or ratifies any such  related person transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described in the committees Key  Practices, which are available on GEs website (see Helpful Resources  on page 81), in the course of reviewing and approving or ratifying a  disclosable related person transaction, the committee considers the  factors in the box to the right.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FACTORS USED IN ASSESSING RELATED PERSON  TRANSACTIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nature of related persons interest in transaction
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Material transaction terms, including amount involved and  type of transaction
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Importance of transaction to related person and GE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether transaction would impair a director or executive  officers judgment to act in GEs best interest
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any other matters the committee deems appropriate,  including any third-party fairness opinions or other expert  reviews obtained in connection with the transaction
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TRANSACTIONS FOR 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There were no related person  transactions for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Information
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 16(a) Beneficial Ownership Reporting Compliance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 16(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (Exchange Act)  requires GEs directors and executive officers, and persons who  beneficially own more than 10% of our common or preferred stock, to  file reports with the SEC regarding their initial stock ownership and  changes in their ownership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TIMELINESS OF 2016 REPORTS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based solely on a review of the  reports filed for fiscal 2016 and related written representations,  we believe that all of our executive officers and directors filed the  required reports on a timely basis under Section 16(a), except that  one Form 4 to report a lapse of RSU restrictions for Susan Peters and  one transaction that should have been included on Form 3 to report  RSU holdings for David Joyce were inadvertently filed late due to  administrative error.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GE PRACTICES.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a practical matter, GE assists its directors  and officers by monitoring transactions and completing and filing  Section 16 reports on their behalf.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GE 2017 Proxy Statement Governance  Stock Ownership Information
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overview of Our Executive Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management Proposal Nos. 1 & 2 ADVISORY APPROVAL OF OUR NAMED  EXECUTIVES PAY & FREQUENCY OF  FUTURE VOTES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the executive compensation discussion in this proxy statement focuses on  the compensation decisions for our named executives   Jeff Immelt (Chair & CEO),  Jeff Bornstein (SVP & CFO), Beth Comstock (Vice Chair & CEO of Business Innovations),  David Joyce (Vice Chair & CEO of Aviation), John Rice (Vice Chair & CEO of our Global  Growth Organization) and Keith Sherin (Former Vice Chair & CEO of GE Capital)   our  executive compensation programs apply broadly across GEs employee ranks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For  example, approximately 120,000 employees participate in an annual bonus program,  more than 5,000 executives receive equity incentives, and approximately 1,000 senior  executives participate in our long-term performance award (LTPA) program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We strive  to pay fair and competitive wages to all of our employees, considering the specific job  markets and peer compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What are you voting on?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with Section 14A of the Exchange  Act, we are asking shareowners to vote on an  advisory basis on:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Say on pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approval of the compensation  paid to our named executives, as described in  this proxy statement (Management Proposal  No. 1).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Say on frequency.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approval of the frequency  of future say-on-pay votes (Management  Proposal No. 2).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareowners are not voting  to approve the Boards recommendation, but  rather will be able to specify whether future  votes should occur every one year, two years  or three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key Considerations in Setting Pay
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EMPHASIS ON CONSISTENT, SUSTAINABLE AND RELATIVE  PERFORMANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation program provides the greatest pay opportunity for named  executives who demonstrate superior performance for sustained periods of time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It  also rewards them for executing GEs strategy through business cycles (for example,  maintaining consistent levels of R&D investment through economic cycles).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In  evaluating performance consistency, we also weigh the performance of each named  executive relative to peers in the relevant industry segment or function.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why the Board recommends a vote FOR the  say-on-pay proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that  our compensation policies and practices are  effective in achieving the companys goals of:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rewarding sustained financial and operating  performance and leadership excellence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Aligning our executives interests with those  of our shareowners to create long-term value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CHALLENGING PERFORMANCE METRICS ALIGNED TO OUR  INVESTOR FRAMEWORK
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Motivating executives to remain with us for  long and productive careers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We set performance metrics for our incentive compensation programs that match  our short-term and long-term operating frameworks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We set target performance  levels that are challenging but achievable with good performance, and maximum  performance levels that represent stretch goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, all of our LTPA programs  have paid out at less than 105% of target performance, with payouts ranging between  71% and 104%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why the Board recommends holding future  say-on-pay votes EVERY YEAR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have  engaged shareowners on this issue and, based  on their feedback, we believe that a significant  portion of our investors would prefer an annual  say-on-pay vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Boards policy of  providing for annual votes, the next say-on-pay  vote will occur at our 2018 annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FUTURE PAY OPPORTUNITY VERSUS CURRENT PAY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee strives to provide an appropriate mix of compensation  elements, including finding a balance between current and long-term compensation  and between cash and equity incentive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash payments primarily are  aligned with and reward more recent performance, while equity awards encourage our  named executives to continue to deliver results over a longer period of time and also  serve as a retention tool.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee believes that most of our named executives  compensation should be contingent on company performance, with an emphasis on  long-term operating and stock-price performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Impact of the votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These advisory proposals  are not binding on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Board  and the Compensation Committee will review and  consider the voting results when evaluating our  executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: YOUR BOARD RECOMMENDS A VOTE FOR  THE SAY-ON-PAY PROPOSAL AND FOR  HOLDING FUTURE SAY-ON-PAY VOTES  EVERY YEAR
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION COMMITTEE JUDGMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation programs balance arrangements where the payouts are tied to  specific quantitative performance objectives with those where the committee evaluates  a broad range of quantitative and qualitative factors, such as reliability in delivering  financial and growth targets, sustainability-focused measures (including performance  in light of risk assumed), performance in the context of the economic environment  relative to other companies, a track record of integrity, good judgment, the ability to  create further growth and lead others, and the absolute size of total pay packages.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GE 2017 Proxy Statement Compensation  Overview of Our Executive Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SIGNIFICANCE OF OVERALL COMPANY RESULTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committees evaluation of the named executives performance places strong emphasis on their contributions to the companys overall  performance rather than focusing only on their particular businesses or functions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee believes that the named executives, as key  members of the companys leadership team, share the responsibility to support GEs goals and performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While this compensation philosophy  influences all of the committees compensation decisions, it has the biggest impact on annual equity incentive grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CONSIDERATION OF RISK
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation programs are balanced and also focused on the long term so that our named executives can achieve the highest compensation  through consistent superior performance over sustained periods of time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, large amounts of compensation are usually deferred or  realizable only upon retirement, providing strong incentives to manage for the long term while avoiding excessive risk-taking in the short term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Goals and objectives, which include specific, risk- and sustainability-focused measures, reflect a balanced mix of performance measures to  avoid placing excessive weight on any single measure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation is also balanced among current cash payments, deferred cash and equity  awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With limited exceptions, the committee retains discretion to adjust compensation pursuant to our clawback policy as well as for quality of  performance and adherence to company values.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See How We Oversee & Manage Risk on page 25 for more information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Performance Awards (LTPAs)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Five equally weighted performance metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash returned to  investors was added as a metric to the four metrics in the prior  program to incentivize returning excess cash to shareowners, and  margins replaced the Industrial earnings percentage metric in light  of the substantial progress made on the GE Capital exit plan;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We grant LTPAs only once every three or more years, in contrast to  many companies that grant such awards annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These awards  have formulaically determined payouts, based on equally weighted  performance metrics that the Compensation Committee sets at  the beginning of each three-year performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over the  last five LTPA programs, the committee has largely used consistent  performance metrics (earnings, cash generation and ROTC), modifying  them only to realign them with changes in our strategic focus (as with  the Industrial operating profit margin and cash returned to investors  metrics in our 20162018 LTPA program).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LTPAs are paid in cash or, at  the committees discretion, in stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lower payout multiples for the named executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payout  multiples were set at 0.50X, 1.00X, 2.00X at threshold, target and  maximum performance (versus 0.75X, 1.50X and 2.00X in the prior  program) as part of the committees consideration of the size of  total pay packages; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payout multiples based on final salary + average bonus during  the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payout multiples are based on salary in  effect at the end of the performance period plus the average bonus  received for the three years in the performance period (compared  to the higher of participants 2014 and 2015 bonuses in the prior  program) in light of the increased volatility in bonus amounts under  our new annual bonus program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In March 2016, the Compensation Committee  granted contingent LTPAs for the 20162018 performance period to  approximately 1,000 executives across the company, including the  named executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The awards are payable based on achievement of  the performance metrics shown in the table below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TARGET PERFORMANCE LEVELS ARE CHALLENGING.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As with our  prior LTPA programs, the target performance levels of the 20162018  LTPA metrics are challenging and difficult to achieve, while the  maximum performance levels represent stretch goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Historically, GE used a different equity compensation structure  for the CEO than for other senior leaders: the CEO typically  received equity compensation solely in the form of PSUs while other  senior leaders received it largely in the form of stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In  2015, we began granting annual equity incentive awards to all named  executives in the form of stock options, RSUs and PSUs to better align  the equity compensation structure for the companys most senior  leaders and drive greater accountability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How we determine award amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual equity incentive awards  are targeted to be equally weighted (by approximate accounting value)  among stock options, RSUs and PSUs, except that the CEOs award is  targeted to be weighted 2/3 PSUs and 1/3 options (he does not receive  RSUs).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining award amounts, the committee evaluates  executives achievement of specific performance goals   with strong  emphasis on their contributions to overall company performance in  addition to their individual business or function   as well as expected  future contributions to GEs long-term success, using past performance  as a key indicator.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HOW THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE CALCULATES PAYOUTS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For each named executive, LTPA payouts are calculated as shown  below (payout multiples for other participants start at significantly  lower levels).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There is no payout for performance below the  threshold level, and amounts are prorated for performance between  the established levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LTPAs are subject to forfeiture under our  compensation recoupment policy or if employment terminates before  the end of the performance period for any reason other than disability,  death or retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why we use equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity awards encourage our named  executives to continue to deliver results over a longer period of time,  and they also serve as a retention tool.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why we use stock options and RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that stock  options and RSUs are a means to effectively focus our named  executives on delivering long-term value to our shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Options have value only to the extent that the price of GE stock  rises between the grant date and the exercise date, and RSUs  reward and retain the named executives by offering them the  opportunity to receive GE stock if they are still employed by us on  the date the restrictions lapse.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: December 2018 Salary LTPA Payout Multiple 0.5X threshold  1.0X target  2.0X maximum Average Bonus  (20162018)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why we use PSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We see PSUs as a means to focus our  named executives on GEs long-term operating goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PSUs have  formulaically determined payouts that convert into shares of  GE stock only if the company achieves specified performance  goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See the Outstanding Equity Awards Table on page 43  for information regarding the performance conditions for  outstanding PSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HOW THE PAYOUT STRUCTURE FOR OUR NAMED EXECUTIVES  DIFFERS FROM THE STRUCTURE FOR OTHER EXECUTIVES.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To  enhance the transparency of the LTPA program and reinforce the  impact of participants efforts over each year in the performance  period, LTPAs are credited to each named executives deferred  compensation account in annual installments but not actually paid  out until after the third year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (This installment structure does not  apply to Mr. Joyce for the 20162018 LTPAs, as he was not a named  executive when they were granted.)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount of each installment  is calculated, following the end of each year in the performance  period, by multiplying total cash compensation at the time by 30%  of the projected total 3-year payout percentage (up to the target  payout level for the first year).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following the third year, the named  executives receive the amounts credited, without interest, adjusted  to reflect GEs actual 3-year performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The first-year installment is reported as 2016 compensation in the LTPAs column in the Summary  Compensation Table on page 38.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company has offered both a deferred bonus program and, from time to time, a deferred salary program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These deferral programs are intended to  promote retention by providing a long-term savings opportunity on a tax-efficient basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The deferred salary program is viewed as a strong retention  tool because executives generally must remain with the company for at least five years after deferral to receive any interest on deferred balances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, because the deferral programs are unfunded and deferred payments are satisfied from the companys general assets, they provide an  incentive for the companys executives to minimize risks that could jeopardize the long-term financial health of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Bonus Deferrals
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ELIGIBILITY AND DEFERRAL OPTIONS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees in our executive band and above, including the named executives, can elect to defer all  or a portion of their bonus payments into the deferral options shown below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants may change their election among these options four  times per year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TIME AND FORM OF PAYMENT.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants can elect to receive their deferred compensation balance upon termination of employment either in a lump sum or in 10 to 20 annual installments.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ELIGIBILITY.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We periodically offer eligible employees in our executive  band and above the opportunity to defer their salary payments (the  last such plan was offered in 2010 for 2011 salary).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individuals who are  named executives at the time a deferred salary program is initiated are not eligible to participate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TIME AND FORM OF PAYMENT.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our deferred salary programs  have required participants to elect, before the salary was deferred,  to receive deferred amounts either in a lump sum or in 10 to 20  annual installments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company makes all decisions regarding the measures for  calculating interest or other earnings on deferred bonuses and salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The named executives cannot withdraw any amounts from their  deferred compensation balances until they either leave or retire  from GE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: INTEREST INCOME.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These programs provide accrued interest  on deferred amounts (including an above-market interest rate as  defined by the SEC) ranging from 6% to 14% compounded annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant who terminates employment before the end of the five- year vesting period will receive a payout of the deferred amount but  will forfeit the accrued interest (with exceptions for events such as  retirement, death and disability).

sentences.text: Pension Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company provides retirement benefits to the named executives  under the same GE Pension Plan and GE Supplementary Pension Plan  in which other eligible employees participate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Pension Plan is a  funded, tax-qualified plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Supplementary Pension Plan, which  increases retirement benefits above amounts available under the  Pension Plan, is an unfunded, unsecured obligation of the company  and is not qualified for tax purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because participants generally  forfeit any benefits under this plan if they leave the company before  age 60, we believe it is a strong retention tool that significantly reduces  departures of high-performing executives and greatly enhances the  caliber of the companys executive workforce.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, because the  Supplementary Pension Plan is unfunded and benefit payments are  satisfied from the companys general assets, it provides an incentive  for executives to minimize risks that could jeopardize the long-term  financial health of GE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BENEFIT FORMULA.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A named executives annual supplementary  pension, when combined with certain amounts payable under the  companys other pension programs and Social Security, will equal  1.75% of his or her earnings credited for retirement benefits  multiplied by the number of years of credited service, up to a maximum  of 60% of such earnings credited for retirement benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The earnings  credited for retirement benefits are the named executives average  annual compensation (base salary and bonus) for the highest 36  consecutive months out of the last 120 months prior to retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TIME AND FORM OF PAYMENT.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees are generally not eligible  for benefits under the Supplementary Pension Plan if they leave the  company before age 60.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The normal retirement age under this plan  is 65; however, employees who began working at GE prior to 2005,  including the named executives, may retire at age 60 without any  reduction in benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The plan provides for spousal joint and survivor  annuities for the named executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits under this plan would be  available to the named executives only as monthly payments and could not be received in a lump sum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GE Pension Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ELIGIBILITY AND VESTING.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The GE Pension Plan is a broad-based  retirement program that is closed to new participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligible  employees vest in the plan after five years of qualifying service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  plan also requires employee contributions, which vest immediately.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GE Excess Benefits Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ELIGIBILITY.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The GE Excess Benefits Plan is an unfunded and non- tax-qualified retirement program that is offered to employees whose  benefits under the GE Pension Plan are limited by certain tax code  provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There were no accruals for named executives under this  plan in 2016, and the company expects only insignificant accruals, if  any, under this plan in future years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BENEFIT FORMULA.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the named executives, the plan provides  benefits based primarily on a formula that takes into account their  earnings for each fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 1989, this formula has provided an  annual benefit accrual equal to 1.45% of a named executives earnings  for the year up to covered compensation and 1.9% of his or her earnings  for the year in excess of covered compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Covered compensation was $50,000 for 2016 and has varied over the years based in part on  changes in the Social Security taxable wage base.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of the  formula, annual earnings include base salary and up to one-half of  bonus payments, but may not exceed an IRS-prescribed limit applicable  to tax-qualified plans ($265,000 for 2016).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, the maximum  incremental annual benefit a named executive could have earned for  service in 2016 was $4,810.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over the years, we have made special  one-time adjustments to this plan that increased eligible participants  pensions, but we did not make any such adjustment in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BENEFIT FORMULA.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits payable under this plan are equal to the  amount that would be payable under the terms of the GE Pension Plan  disregarding the limitations imposed by certain tax code provisions  minus the amount actually payable under the GE Pension Plan taking  those limitations into account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TIME AND FORM OF PAYMENT.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits for the named executives  are generally payable at the same time and in the same manner as  their GE Pension Plan benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NO EMPLOYMENT OR INDIVIDUAL SEVERANCE AGREEMENTS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our named executives serve at the will of the Board and do not have  individual employment, severance or change-of-control agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This preserves the Compensation Committees flexibility to set the  terms of any employment termination based on the particular facts  and circumstances.

sentences.text: EARLY RETIREMENT AGREEMENT WITH MR. SHERIN.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Sherin  retired on December 31, 2016 after a 35-year career with GE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In  connection with this, we entered into an early retirement agreement  with Mr. Sherin pursuant to which, subject to a 12-month non-compete,  Mr. Sherin will receive: (1) his 2016 annual cash bonus (as reported in  the Summary Compensation Table) and a prorated 20162018 LTPA  payment, in each case based upon actual company performance and  determined in accordance with the companys normal processes;  (2) accelerated vesting (the PSUs remain subject to actual company  performance) and up to a 5-year extension of the expiration period for  his outstanding equity awards (the value of which is reported in the  Summary Compensation Table), consistent with the benefits provided
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION COMMITTEE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee has primary  responsibility for helping the Board develop and evaluate potential  candidates for executive positions and for overseeing the development  of executive succession plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of this responsibility, the  committee oversees the compensation program for the CEO and the  other named executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: STRATEGIC USE OF COMPENSATION CONSULTANTS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From time  to time, the Compensation Committee and the companys human  resources function have sought the views of Frederic W. Cook & Co.,  Inc. (Frederic Cook) about market intelligence on compensation trends  and on particular compensation programs designed by our human  resources function.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the Compensation Committee chair  and the companys human resources function consulted with Frederic  Cook on market practices related to senior executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Governance Committee and the companys legal  function consulted with Frederic Cook on market practices relating to  compensation and benefits for non-employee directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition,  the companys human resource function consulted with Exequity to  obtain its views and information on the companys broad-based 2007  Long-Term Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of these services were obtained under  hourly fee arrangements rather than through a standing engagement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MANAGEMENT.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO and our senior vice president, human  resources, help the committee administer our executive compensation  program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The senior vice president, human resources, also advises  the committee on matters such as past compensation, total annual  compensation, potential accrued benefits, GE compensation practices  and guidelines, company performance, industry compensation  practices and competitive market information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How We Establish Performance  Goals and Evaluate Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION CONSULTANT INDEPENDENCE POLICY.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any  compensation consultant that advises the Board on executive  or director compensation will not at the same time advise the  company on any other human resources matter, and the committee  has determined that Frederic Cooks work with the committee,  Governance Committee and the companys human resources function does not raise any conflict of interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ESTABLISHING PERFORMANCE GOALS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the beginning of each  year, Mr. Immelt develops the objectives that he believes should be  achieved for the company to be successful.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He then reviews these  objectives with the Compensation Committee for the corollary  purpose of establishing how the committee will assess his and the  other named executives performance, including forming the basis for  the performance metrics and strategic goals included in the annual  bonus plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These objectives are derived largely from the companys  annual financial and strategic planning sessions, during which the  Board and management conduct in-depth reviews of the companys  growth opportunities and establish goals for the upcoming year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  objectives include quantitative financial measurements as well as  qualitative strategic, risk and operational considerations, and are  focused on those factors that our CEO and the committee believe  create long-term shareowner value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LIMITED USE OF PEER GROUP COMPARISONS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation  Committee considers executive compensation at the other Dow 30  companies as just one among several factors in setting pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It does not target a percentile within this group and instead uses the comparative  data merely as a reference point in exercising its judgment about  compensation types and amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawbacks and Other Remedies for  Potential Misconduct
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CLAWBACKS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board may seek reimbursement from an executive  officer if it determines that the officer engaged in conduct that was  detrimental to the company and resulted in a material inaccuracy  in either our financial statements or in performance metrics that  affected the officers compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Board determines that  the officer engaged in fraudulent misconduct, it will seek such  reimbursement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information, see the Boards Governance  Principles (see Helpful Resources on page 81).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EVALUATING PERFORMANCE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Immelt leads the assessment of  each named executives individual performance against the objectives  established for that executive, the companys overall performance  and the performance of the executives business or function, and  makes an initial compensation recommendation to the Compensation  Committee for each executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In doing so, he solicits the input  of, and receives advice and data from, our senior vice president,  human resources.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Immelt also reviews and discusses preliminary  considerations as to his own compensation with the committee, but  does not participate in the final determination of his compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The named executives also play no role in their compensation  determinations, other than discussing with the CEO their individual  performance against predetermined objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OTHER REMEDIES.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In cases of detrimental misconduct by an  executive officer, the Board may also take a range of other actions  to remedy the misconduct, prevent its recurrence, and discipline  the individual as appropriate, including terminating the individuals  employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These remedies would be in addition to, and not in lieu  of, any actions imposed by law enforcement agencies, regulators or  other authorities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Deductibility of Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Share Ownership and Equity Grant Policies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Internal Revenue Code generally imposes a $1 million limit on the  amount that a public company may deduct for compensation paid to  the companys named executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This limitation does not apply to  compensation that meets the tax code requirements for qualifying  performance-based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to compensation  reported in the Summary Compensation Table for 2016, annual cash  bonus payments as well as PSU, RSU and stock option grants were  designed to satisfy the requirements for deductible compensation  (but we may pay compensation that does not qualify as deductible).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To allow annual bonus payments, LTPA payments and grants of PSUs  and RSUs to qualify as deductible, the Compensation Committee  established a performance goal (positive net earnings, adjusted to  remove the impact under GAAP of unusual events) and the maximum  amounts that could be granted to the executive officers (expressed  as a percentage of adjusted net earnings).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: That goal was met for 2016,  and the bonus payments and PSU and RSU grant amounts were within  the pre-established limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because deductibility is determined under  a set of standards that may be subject to different interpretations  in application, arrangements intended to satisfy the deductibility  requirements may subsequently be determined not to be deductible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HOW DEFERRED STOCK UNITS WORK.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each DSU is equal in value  to a share of GE stock and is fully vested upon grant, but does not have  voting rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To calculate the number of DSUs to be granted, we divide  the target value of the DSUs by the average closing price of GE stock for the 20 days preceding and including the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DSUs accumulate  quarterly dividend-equivalent payments, which are reinvested into  additional DSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The DSUs are paid out in cash beginning one year  after the director leaves the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors may elect to take their  DSU payments as a lump sum or in payments spread out for up to  10 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Products and Lighting Program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent  directors could participate in our Executive Products and Lighting  Program on the same basis as our named executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this  program, directors could receive up to $30,000 in GE appliances  over a three-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This program terminated in June 2016  when we sold our Appliances business, but directors can continue  to receive light bulbs going forward.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
