sentences.text: What are you voting on?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are asking shareowners to approve  the GE 2007 Long-Term Incentive  Plan (Plan), as amended to extend  the term of the Plan, increase the  number of authorized shares and make  other changes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If shareowners approve this proposal, the Plan would be amended to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Authorize GE to issue up to 150 million additional shares for use under the Plan,  which would bring the total number of authorized shares to 1,075 million (although  25 million of these shares would come from the reallocation of shares from the  Consultants Plan to the Plan), of which 373.5 million would be available for new grants  after 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why the Board recommends a vote  FOR the amended plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purposes  of the plan are to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Extend the term of the Plan by ten years, with the 2027 annual meeting as the end date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Raise the limit on the number of shares available for incentive stock options by  150 million (same as the increase in the share pool).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Encourage selected salaried  employees to acquire a proprietary  interest in the growth and  performance of GE;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Add non-employee directors as participants under the Plan, bringing the director DSU  program under the auspices of the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Establish an annual limit for director compensation (both cash and equity) at  $1.5 million per year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generate an increased incentive  to contribute to GEs future success  and prosperity, thus enhancing the  value of the company; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clarify that Plan awards are subject to the companys clawback policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Make other, non-substantive changes to the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Enhance the ability of the company  to attract and retain exceptionally  qualified individuals upon whom  the sustained progress, growth and  profitability of GE depend.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How Long We Expect the Share Pool to Last
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expect that the proposed share pool for new grants under the Plan (i.e., the 373.5 million  shares available for grants after 2016), if shareowners approve this proposal, will last four to  five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, regardless of actual Plan usage, as a matter of good corporate governance,  we intend to ask shareowners to reapprove the Plan no later than the 2022 annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is consistent with our historical practice of seeking shareowner approval for the Plan every  five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amended plan would further these  objectives by allowing GE to continue to  grant awards under the Plan for another  four to five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How the Plan is Designed to Protect Shareowners Interests
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: YOUR BOARD RECOMMENDS  A VOTE FOR APPROVAL OF THE  GE 2007 LONG-TERM INCENTIVE  PLAN, AS AMENDED
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following features of the Plan will continue to protect the interests of our shareowners:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Limits on authorized shares   no evergreen provision.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the amendment to the Plan is  approved, the maximum number of shares available for grants of stock options and other  stock awards will be 1,075 million, including shares that have been granted since the Plans  adoption in 2007.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Of these shares, no more than 230 million are available for full value  awards (e.g., RSUs and PSUs).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Plan does not have an evergreen feature.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GES CURRENT EQUITY PRACTICES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Balanced mix of PSUs, RSUs & options  for senior officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Limits on terms of stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum terms of each stock option and SAR that  can be granted under the Plan is ten years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term vesting with 5 years for options/RSUs, 3 years for PSUs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Limits on share counting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares surrendered or withheld for the payment of the  exercise price or taxes under stock options or SARs, shares surrendered or withheld for the  payment of taxes on RSUs, PSUs and other full value awards, and shares repurchased in  the open market with the proceeds of an option exercise, may not again be made available  for issuance under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No dividend equivalent payments to  executive officers on unearned RSUs/PSUs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Share buybacks to offset dilution from  equity programs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No stock option repricing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Plan prohibits the repricing of underwater options and  SARs, whether by amending an existing award, substituting a new award at a lower price or executing a cash buyout.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No discounted stock option grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Plan prohibits granting stock options or SARs  with an exercise price less than the fair market value of GE stock on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No automatic change-of-control benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Plan does not provide any automatic  benefits upon a change of control or any excise tax gross-ups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Frequently Asked Questions About the Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This summary is qualified by reference to the complete text of the Plan,  which can be found in Appendix A on page 74 to this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESTRICTED STOCK AND RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee will establish the  applicable restrictions (including limitations on voting and dividend  rights) and vesting schedule of these awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who can participate in the Plan?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PERFORMANCE AWARDS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These awards may be denominated  in either cash or shares, and are subject to the achievement of  performance goals over set performance periods, as established by  the committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All salaried employees of GE and its affiliates   approximately  185,000 employees in total   are eligible to participate in the Plan,  along with the companys 17 non-employee directors (assuming  Dr. Lavizzo-Mourey is elected).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OTHER STOCK-BASED AWARDS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee may grant other  stock-based awards, including DSUs, that are valued by reference to or  denominated or payable in shares, under such terms as it determines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who administers the Plan?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the committee will determine (1) whether an award  includes dividends or dividend equivalents (other than stock options or  SARs); (2) what happens if a participant terminates employment; and  (3) whether shares of GE stock issuable under an award are subject to  additional restrictions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards generally are not transferable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GENERALLY.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Plan is administered by the Compensation  Committee, an independent committee of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee  has the authority to make any determination or take any action that it  deems necessary or desirable to administer the Plan, and also has the  sole discretion to interpret the Plan and all award agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With  limited exceptions, the committee can delegate its authority under  the Plan to the committee chairman, a subcommittee or to GE officers  or managers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Are there minimum vesting periods  for Plan awards?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AS IT RELATES TO DIRECTOR COMPENSATION.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If this proposal is  approved, the Governance Committee will administer the Plan as it  relates to director compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Plan does not have minimum vesting periods for Plan awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the committee generally believes that options and RSUs  should have vesting periods of at least five years (absent compelling  recruitment and retention considerations) and PSUs should have  performance periods of at least three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with this, over  the last three years, more than 95% of the awards granted under the  Plan met these conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How many shares are available for  Plan awards?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If this proposal is approved, a total of 1,075 million shares will have  been authorized for issuance under the Plan (including 25 million  shares that were reallocated from the Consultants Plan), of which  701.5 million have been granted as of December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares  delivered pursuant to an award may consist of authorized and  unissued shares or treasury shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Are Plan awards subject to a clawback policy?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Plan awards granted to executive officers and directors are subject to the companys clawback policy (see Clawbacks and Other Remedies  for Potential Misconduct on page 51).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WHAT REDUCES THE SHARE POOL.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards settled in shares  and dividend equivalents denominated in shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What are the per-person  award limits?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WHAT DOES NOT REDUCE THE SHARE POOL.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards made  upon the assumption of or in substitution for outstanding grants  made by a company that we acquire and awards settled in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WHICH SHARES CAN RETURN TO THE SHARE POOL.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Share covered by an award that is terminated or forfeited because  payout conditions are not met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to any adjustments that the committee makes (as described  below), the Plan limits the number of shares that can be granted to an  individual in any three-year period as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3-year per-person limit Stock options & SARs 9 million shares Other awards 3 million shares
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, if this proposal is approved, there will be an annual  limit on director compensation set at $1,500,000 per director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This  would include awards granted under the Plan as well as cash or  other compensation paid by the company with respect to service  as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In certain circumstances, the committee may make an  exception and grant compensation above this limit (up to an additional  $1,000,000).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, this exception would permit awards under  the companys Charitable Award Program (which has been closed to  new directors).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The last sales price of GEs common shares, $0.06 par value, on  February 10, 2017 was $29.72 per share, as reported on the NYSE.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: STOCK OPTIONS AND SARs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum term for either stock  options or SARs is ten years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Options may be either nonqualified  stock options or incentive stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee will establish  the vesting schedule and the method for paying the exercise price of  these awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GE 2017 Proxy Statement Compensation  2007 LTIP Approval
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What adjustments can the  committee make under the Plan?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whats the duration of the Plan?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Plan became effective on the date of our 2007 annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If  this proposal is approved, the Plan will be extended for an additional  ten years, such that no award may be granted under the Plan after the  date of our 2027 annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ANTI-DILUTION ADJUSTMENTS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of certain corporate  transactions affecting GEs outstanding common shares   such as a  dividend, recapitalization, stock split, merger, consolidation, split-up,  spin-off, or exchange of shares   the committee will make adjustments  as it deems appropriate to prevent dilution or enlargement of Plan  benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This could include changes to the number and type of shares  to be issued under the Plan and outstanding awards, the exercise price  of outstanding awards, and Plan and per-person limits on the number  of shares that can be granted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How can the Plan or awards be  amended?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AMENDMENTS TO THE PLAN.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board may amend, suspend  or terminate the Plan, but will seek shareowner approval of any  amendment that would:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PERFORMANCE CRITERIA ADJUSTMENTS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee may  adjust performance award criteria in recognition of unusual or  infrequently recurring events affecting GE or its financial statements  or changes in applicable laws, regulations, or accounting principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Increase the number of authorized shares under the  Plan (except in connection with anti-dilution adjustments as  discussed above);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Permit underwater stock options or SARs to be repriced, replaced or exchanged; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ACQUISITION-RELATED ADJUSTMENTS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee may  also adjust award terms in connection with business acquisitions in  which GE assumes outstanding employee awards or the right to make  future awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Otherwise be considered a material amendment under  NYSE rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AMENDMENTS TO AWARDS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee may waive award  conditions or amend or terminate awards, but may not impair the  rights of the award holder without his or her consent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GE 2017 Proxy Statement Compensation  2007 LTIP Approval
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Information About the Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Summary of U.S. Federal Income Tax  Consequences
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Plan Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEW PLAN BENEFITS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards granted under the Plan are within the discretion of the committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the committee has not determined  future awards or who might receive them, the benefits that will be  provided under the Plan are not currently determinable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following summary of tax consequences to GE and to Plan  participants is intended to be used solely by shareowners in  considering how to vote on this proposal and not as tax guidance to  participants in the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It relates only to federal income tax and does  not address state, local or foreign income tax rules or other U.S. tax  provisions, such as estate or gift taxes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Different tax rules may apply  to specific participants and transactions under the Plan, particularly  in jurisdictions outside the United States.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, this summary  is as of the date of this proxy statement; federal income tax laws and  regulations are frequently revised and may be changed again at any  time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, each recipient is urged to consult a tax advisor before  exercising any award or before disposing of any shares acquired under  the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Until this proposal is approved,  nonemployee directors cannot participate in the Plan.

sentences.text: STOCK OPTIONS AND SARs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grant of an option or SAR will create  no tax consequences for the participant or the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant  will have no taxable income upon exercise of an incentive stock option,  except that the alternative minimum tax may apply.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon exercise of  an option other than an incentive stock option, a participant generally  must recognize ordinary income equal to the fair market value of the  shares acquired minus the exercise price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When disposing of shares  acquired by exercise of an incentive stock option before the end of  the applicable incentive stock option holding periods, the participant  generally must recognize ordinary income equal to the lesser of  (1) the fair market value of the shares at the date of exercise minus  the exercise price or (2) the amount realized upon the disposition  of the shares minus the exercise price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Otherwise, a participants  disposition of shares acquired upon the exercise of an option (including  an incentive stock option for which the incentive stock option holding  periods are met) generally will result in only capital gain or loss.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OTHER AWARDS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other awards under the Plan generally will result  in ordinary income to the participant at the later of the time of  delivery of cash, shares, or other awards, or the time that either the  risk of forfeiture or restriction on transferability lapses on previously delivered cash, shares or other awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPANY DEDUCTION.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except as discussed below, the company is  generally entitled to a tax deduction equal to the amount recognized as ordinary income by the participant in connection with options, SARs or  other awards, but not for amounts the participant recognizes as capital gain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thus, the company will not be entitled to any tax deduction with  respect to an incentive stock option if the participant holds the shares  for the incentive stock option holding periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IMPACT OF SECTION 162(m) DEDUCTION LIMITATION.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section  162(m) generally allows deductions without limit for compensation  that qualifies as performance based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GE intends that options and  SARs granted under the Plan will continue to qualify as performance- based compensation not subject to a deductibility cap (based on  our shareowners original approval of the Plan), as will RSUs and  performance awards if shareowners approve the material terms  of the performance goals described under Management Proposal  No. 4   Approval of the Material Terms of Senior Officer Performance  Goals on page 61.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, a number of requirements must be  met in order for particular compensation to so qualify, so there can  be no assurance that these types of compensation under the Plan  will be fully deductible under all circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, other  types of compensation provided under the Plan may not qualify as  performance-based compensation under Section 162(m) and therefore may not be deductible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GE 2017 Proxy Statement Compensation  2007 LTIP Approval
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of Section 162(m), the material terms of the performance goals include  the following:

sentences.text: Why are we asking you to vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) imposes a $1 million  limit on the amount that a public  company may deduct for compensation  paid to the companys CEO or any of  the companys three other most highly  compensated executive officers (other  than the CFO) who are employed as of  the end of the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This limitation does  not apply to compensation that meets  the requirements under Section 162(m)  for qualifying performance-based  compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One of the requirements  for compensation to qualify is that the  material terms of the performance goals for such compensation be approved by  shareowners every five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee expects to continue to use annual net earnings as determined  under GAAP, adjusted to remove the effect under GAAP of unusual events (adjusted net  earnings), as the basis for payment of annual bonuses and LTPAs as well as grants of RSUs  (including PSUs).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMMITTEE AUTHORITY TO MEASURE PERFORMANCE GOALS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee may establish  performance goals that are measured either individually, alternatively or in any combination,  are applied to either the company as a whole or to a business unit or related company, and are  measured either annually or cumulatively over a period of years, on an absolute basis or relative to  a pre-established target, to a previous years results or to a designated comparison group, in each  case as specified by the committee in the award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMMITTEE AUTHORITY TO ADJUST PERFORMANCE GOALS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee may adjust the  performance goals to remove the effect of charges for restructurings, discontinued operations  and all items of gain, loss or expense determined to be unusual in nature or infrequent in  occurrence, related to the disposal of a segment or a business, or related to a change in  accounting principle or otherwise.

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is directly responsible for the appointment, compensation (including  advance approval of the audit fee), retention and oversight of the independent registered public  accounting firm that audits our financial statements and our internal control over financial  reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee has selected KPMG as our independent auditor for 2017.

sentences.text: KPMG has  served as our independent auditor since 1909.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are asking our shareowners to  ratify the selection of KPMG LLP  (KPMG) as the independent auditor of  our consolidated financial statements and our internal control over financial  reporting for 2017.

sentences.text: Although ratification is not required by  our by-laws or otherwise, the Board is  submitting this proposal as a matter  of good corporate practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the  selection is not ratified, the committee  will consider whether it is appropriate  to select another independent auditor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if the selection is ratified, the  committee may select a different  independent auditor at any time during  the year if it determines that this would  be in the best interests of GE and our  shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: KPMGs historical and recent performance on the GE audit, including the results of an  internal, worldwide survey of KPMGs service and quality;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: KPMGs capability and expertise in handling the breadth and complexity of our  worldwide operations;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An analysis of KPMGs known legal risks and any significant legal or regulatory  proceedings in which it is involved (including an interview with KPMGs chairman and CEO  and General Counsel and a review of the number of audit clients reporting restatements as  compared to other major accounting firms);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: External data on audit quality and performance, including recent Public Company  Accounting Oversight Board (PCAOB) reports on KPMG and its peer firms;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Appropriateness of KPMGs fees for audit and non-audit services, on both an absolute basis and as compared to its peer firms; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: KPMGs independence and tenure as our auditor, including the benefits and  independence risks of having a long-tenured auditor and controls and processes that help  ensure KPMGs independence (as described below).

sentences.text: Based on this evaluation, the Audit Committee believes that KPMG is independent and that it  is in the best interests of GE and our shareowners to retain KPMG as our independent auditor  for 2017.

sentences.text: Benefits of a Long-Tenured Auditor
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HIGHER AUDIT QUALITY.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through more than 100 years of experience with GE and over  1,350 statutory GE audits annually in more than 80 countries, KPMG has gained institutional  knowledge of and deep expertise regarding GEs global operations and businesses, accounting  policies and practices, and internal control over financial reporting.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: KPMGs aggregate fees are competitive with peer companies  because of KPMGs familiarity with our business.

sentences.text: NO ONBOARDING OR EDUCATING NEW AUDITOR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Bringing on a new auditor requires a  significant time commitment that could distract from managements focus on financial reporting  and internal controls.

sentences.text: How We Control and Monitor  the Non-Audit Services Provided  by KPMG
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has retained KPMG (along with other accounting  firms) to provide non-audit services in 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We understand the need  for KPMG to maintain objectivity and independence as the auditor  of our financial statements and our internal control over financial  reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the committee has established the following  policies and processes related to non-audit services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WE RESTRICT THE NON-AUDIT SERVICES THAT KPMG CAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROVIDE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To minimize relationships that could appear to impair  KPMGs objectivity, the Audit Committee has restricted the types of  non-audit services that KPMG may provide to us (and that otherwise  would be permissible under SEC rules) and requires that the company  engage KPMG only when it is best-suited for the job.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more detail,  see our Audit Committee Key Practices (see Helpful Resources  on page 81).

sentences.text: WE HAVE A PRE-APPROVAL PROCESS FOR NON-AUDIT SERVICES.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has adopted policies and procedures for pre- approving all non-audit work that KPMG performs for us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically,  the committee has pre-approved the use of KPMG for specific types  of services related to: tax compliance, planning and consultations;  acquisition/disposition services, including due diligence; consultations  regarding accounting and reporting matters; and reviews and  consultations on internal control and other related services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  committee has set a specific annual limit on the amount of non- audit services (audit-related and tax services) that the company  can obtain from KPMG.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It has also required management to obtain  specific pre-approval from the committee for any single engagement  over $1 million or any types of services that have not been pre- approved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee chair is authorized to pre-approve any  audit or non-audit service on behalf of the committee, provided these  decisions are presented to the full committee at its next regularly  scheduled meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee  reviews GEs financial reporting process on behalf of the  Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management has the primary responsibility for  establishing and maintaining adequate internal financial  controls, for preparing the financial statements and for the public  reporting process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: KPMG, our companys independent auditor for  2016, is responsible for expressing opinions on the conformity of the  companys audited financial statements with U.S. generally accepted  accounting principles and on the companys internal control over  financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: REQUIRED DISCLOSURES AND DISCUSSIONS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee  has reviewed and discussed with management and KPMG the  audited financial statements for the year ended December 31,  2016 and KPMGs evaluation of the companys internal control over  financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee has also discussed with KPMG the  matters that are required to be discussed under PCAOB standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: KPMG has provided to the committee the written disclosures and  the PCAOB-required letter regarding its communications with the  Audit Committee concerning independence, and the committee has  discussed with KPMG that firms independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee has  concluded that KPMGs provision of audit and non-audit services to GE  and its affiliates is compatible with KPMGs independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We Have Hiring Restrictions for  KPMG Employees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To avoid potential conflicts of interest, the Audit Committee has  adopted restrictions on our hiring of any KPMG partner, director,  manager, staff member, advising member of the department of  professional practice, reviewing actuary, reviewing tax professional  and any other individuals responsible for providing audit assurance  on any aspect of KPMGs audit and review of our financial statements.

sentences.text: These restrictions are contained in our Audit Committee Key Practices  (see Helpful Resources on page 81).

sentences.text: Supporting Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As shareowners, we encourage transparency and accountability in the use of corporate funds  to influence legislation and regulation, both directly and indirectly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GE spent $38.225 million in  2014 and 2015 on direct federal lobbying activities (opensecrets.org).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This figure does not include  lobbying expenditures to influence legislation in states, where GE also lobbies but disclosure is  uneven or absent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, GE spent $381,496 on lobbying in California in 2014 and 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GEs lobbying over the Export-Import Bank has attracted media attention (Ex-Im Backers Spent  Record Amounts Lobbying Government in 2015, Washington Post, January 28, 2016).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GE is a member of the Chamber of Commerce, which has spent more than $1.2 billion  on lobbying since 1998.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GE does not disclose its memberships in, or payments to, trade  associations, or the amounts used for lobbying.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GE will disclose its non-deductible trade  association payments used for political contributions, but this does not cover payments used  for lobbying.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This leaves a serious disclosure gap, as trade associations generally spend far more  on lobbying than on political contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Absent a system of accountability and disclosure,  corporate assets may be used for objectives that pose risks to the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, GE  supports carbon policies that aspire to reduce emissions and signed the American Business  Act on Climate Pledge, yet the Chamber has sued to block the EPA Clean Power Plan to address  climate change.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transparent reporting would reveal whether company assets are being used for objectives  contrary to GEs long-term interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A board of directors is less likely to provide rigorous independent  oversight of management if the Chairman is also the CEO, as is the  case with our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Having a board chairman who is independent  of management is a practice that will promote greater management  accountability to shareholders and lead to a more objective evaluation  of management.

sentences.text: A number of institutional investors said that a strong, objective board  leader can best provide the necessary oversight of management.

sentences.text: Thus,  the California Public Employees Retirement Systems Global Principles  of Accountable Corporate Governance recommends that a companys  board should be chaired by an independent director, as does the  Council of Institutional Investors.

sentences.text: An independent director serving as  chairman can help ensure the functioning of an effective board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: According to the Millstein Center for Corporate Governance and  Performance (Yale School of Management), The independent chair  curbs conflicts of interest, promotes oversight of risk, manages the  relationship between the board and CEO, serves as a conduit for  regular communication with shareowners, and is a logical next step in  the development of an independent board.

sentences.text: OUR LEAD DIRECTOR PROVIDES STRONG, INDEPENDENT  LEADERSHIP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our lead director, John J. Brennan, the former  chairman of the board and chief executive officer of The Vanguard  Group, leads meetings of the independent directors and regularly  meets with the chairman for discussion of matters arising from  these meetings, calls additional meetings of the independent  directors or the entire Board as deemed appropriate, serves as  a liaison on Board-related issues between the chairman and the  independent directors, and performs such other functions as  the Board may direct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described in the Boards Governance  Principles, these other functions include (1) advising the Governance  Committee on the selection of committee chairs, (2) approving  the agenda, schedule and information sent to the directors for  Board meetings, (3) working with the chairman to propose an  annual schedule of major discussion items for the Boards approval,  (4) guiding the Boards governance processes, including the annual  Board self-evaluation, succession planning and other governance- related matters, (5) leading the annual chairman evaluation, and  (6) providing leadership to the Board if circumstances arise in  which the role of the chairman may be, or may be perceived to be,  in conflict, and otherwise act as chairman of Board meetings when  the chairman is not in attendance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The lead director oversees the  Boards periodic review of its leadership structure to ensure it  remains appropriate for the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The lead director also makes  himself available for consultation and direct communication with  the companys major shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE CURRENT LEADERSHIP STRUCTURE IS THE MOST  EFFECTIVE FOR GE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that GEs corporate  governance policies and practices combined with the strength of  our independent directors serve to minimize any potential conflicts  that may result from combining the roles of CEO and chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that the existing structure is the best way  to efficiently and effectively protect and enhance our long-term  success and shareowner value and will continue to monitor the  appropriateness of this structure (as we do with all governance  issues).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the view of the Board, instituting a requirement that the  roles of chair and CEO must be split at a future date is unnecessary,  inadvisable and would risk making our management and governance  processes less effective than they are today for a variety of reasons  that the Board regularly considers as part of its periodic governance  reviews.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 67% of the companies in the Dow 30 currently maintain  combined chair and CEO positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: According to the 2016 Spencer  Stuart Board Index, 73% of companies in the S&P 500 do not have  an independent board chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE BOARD REGULARLY REVIEWS AND ASSESSES OUR BOARD  LEADERSHIP STRUCTURE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on its regular reviews, the Board  believes that our current structure, in which our CEO also serves  as the chairman of the Board and an independent lead director  is appointed by the independent directors on the Board, remains  appropriate for the company, as it allows our CEO to speak for  and lead the company and Board while also providing for effective  oversight and governance by an independent board through the  independent lead director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, the Board recommends a vote  AGAINST this proposal.

sentences.text: REASONS: Many states have mandatory cumulative voting, so do  National Banks.

sentences.text: RESOLVED: That the stockholders of General Electric, assembled in  Annual Meeting in person and by proxy, hereby request the Board of  Directors to take the necessary steps to provide for cumulative voting  in the election of directors, which means each stockholder shall be  entitled to as many votes as shall equal the number of shares he or  she owns multiplied by the number of directors to be elected, and he  or she may cast all of such votes for a single candidate, or any two or  more of them as he or she may see fit.

sentences.text: In addition, many corporations have adopted cumulative voting.

sentences.text: WE HAVE A MAJORITY VOTING STANDARD FOR DIRECTOR
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ELECTIONS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director nominee who receives a majority of the  votes cast will be elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any current director who does not meet  this standard is subject to the Boards policy regarding resignations  by directors who do not receive a majority of For votes, which  is described in the Boards Governance Principles (see Helpful  Resources on page 81).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All other matters are approved if supported by a majority of votes cast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How You Can Vote in Person at  the Meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareowners who hold shares directly with the company may attend  the meeting and vote in person, or may execute a proxy designating  a representative to attend and vote on their behalf.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not hold  your shares directly with us and they are instead held for you in a  brokerage, bank or other institutional account, you may attend and  vote in person if you obtain a proxy from that institution in advance of  the meeting and bring it with you to hand in along with the ballot that  will be provided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How Proxies Will Be Voted
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROXIES WILL BE VOTED AS YOU SPECIFY OR, IF YOU DONT  SPECIFY, AS RECOMMENDED BY THE BOARD.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The shares
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: represented by all valid proxies that are received on time will be voted  as specified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When a valid proxy form is received and it does not  indicate specific choices, the shares represented by that proxy will be  voted in accordance with the Boards recommendations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How You Can Change Your Vote
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WHAT HAPPENS IF OTHER MATTERS ARE PROPERLY PRESENTED  AT THE MEETING.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any matter not described in this proxy statement is properly presented for a vote at the meeting, the persons named on  the proxy will vote in accordance with their judgment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may change your vote by revoking your proxy at any time before  it is exercised, which can be done by voting in person at the meeting,  by delivering a new proxy or by notifying the inspector of election in  writing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your GE shares are held for you in a brokerage, bank or other  institutional account, you must contact that institution to revoke a  previously authorized proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The address for the inspector of election  is IVS Associates, Inc., 1000 N. West Street, Suite 1200, Wilmington,  DE 19801.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WHAT HAPPENS IF A DIRECTOR NOMINEE IS UNABLE TO SERVE We do not know of any reason why any nominee would be unable to  serve as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any nominee is unable to serve, the Board can  either nominate a different individual or reduce the Boards size.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If it  nominates a different individual, the shares represented by all valid  proxies will be voted for that nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We Have a Confidential Voting Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Important Voting Information for  Beneficial Owners
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individual votes of shareowners are kept private, except as necessary  to meet legal requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only the independent inspector and  certain employees of GE and its agents have access to proxies  and other individual shareowner voting records, and they must  acknowledge in writing their responsibility to comply with this  confidentiality policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your GE shares are held for you in a brokerage, bank or other  institutional account, you are considered the beneficial owner of  those shares, but not the record holder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This means that you vote  by providing instructions to your broker rather than directly to the  company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless you provide specific voting instructions, your broker  is not permitted to vote your shares on your behalf, except on the  proposal to ratify KPMG.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For your vote on any other matters to be  counted, you will need to communicate your voting decisions to your  broker, bank or other institution before the date of the annual meeting  using the voting instruction form that the institution provides to you.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you would like to vote your shares at the meeting, you must obtain  a proxy from your financial institution and bring it with you to hand in  with your ballot.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you plan to attend, please follow the instructions below that  correspond to how you hold your GE shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a RSP participant, the trustee of the RSP trust will vote the  shares allocable to your RSP account as of February 23, 2017 as you  instruct (you should consider this date the record date for purposes  of the shares allocable to your RSP account).

sentences.text: You may give instructions  via telephone or the Internet or by mailing the proxy form.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your valid  proxy form is received by April 24, 2017 and it does not specify a choice,  the trustee will vote the shares as the Board recommends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your  proxy form is not received by April 24, 2017 and you did not submit  a vote via telephone or the Internet by that date, shares allocable  to your RSP account will not be voted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may revoke a previously  delivered proxy by either notifying the inspector of election in writing  that you wish to revoke or by delivering a subsequent proxy by April 24,  2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The address for the inspector of election is IVS Associates, Inc.,  1000 N. West Street, Suite 1200, Wilmington, DE 19801.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more  information about the voting process, you can call the GE RSP Service  Center at 1-877-55-GERSP (1-877-554-3777).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold your GE shares directly with the company and you  received a proxy form, or you hold your GE shares through the  GE Retirement Savings Plan, please follow the advance registration  instructions on the top portion of your proxy form, which was included  in the mailing from the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold your GE shares directly with the company, and you  received a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials or  you received your proxy materials by email, please follow the  advance registration instructions provided when you vote on the  Internet or, if you are voting by telephone, please follow the steps  below for submitting an advance registration request and include a  copy of your Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials or email,  as applicable, as your proof of ownership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold your GE shares through a brokerage, bank or other  institutional account, please send an advance registration request to  GE Shareowner Services, 1 River Road, Building 5 3E, Schenectady, NY  12345, and include the following information:

sentences.text: The names of any family members who will accompany you
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you have any questions about the proxy voting process, please  contact the broker, bank or other institution where you hold your  shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SEC also has a website (see Helpful Resources on  page 81) with more information about your rights as a shareowner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, you may contact our Investor Relations team by following  the instructions on our Investor Relations website (see Helpful  Resources on page 81).

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Appendix A
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GE 2007 Long-Term Incentive Plan   (as amended and restated April 26, 2017)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 1.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PURPOSE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (k) Non-Qualified Stock Option shall mean an option granted under  Section 6(a) of the Plan that is not intended to be an Incentive  Stock Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purposes of this GE 2007 Long-Term Incentive Plan (the Plan)  are to encourage selected Salaried Employees and Directors of  General Electric Company (together with any successor thereto,  the Company) and its Affiliates (as defined below) to acquire a  proprietary interest in the growth and performance of the Company, to  generate an increased incentive to contribute to the Companys future  success and prosperity, thus enhancing the value of the Company  for the benefit of its shareowners, and to enhance the ability of the  Company and its Affiliates to attract and retain exceptionally qualified  individuals upon whom, in large measure, the sustained progress,  growth and profitability of the Company depend.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (l) Option shall mean an Incentive Stock Option or a Non-Qualified  Stock Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (m) Other Stock-Based Award shall mean any right, including a  Deferred Stock Unit, granted under Section 6(f) of the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (n) Participant shall mean a Salaried Employee or Director  designated to be granted an Award under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (o) Performance Award shall mean any right granted under Section 6(d) of the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (p) Performance Criteria shall mean any quantitative and/or  qualitative measures, as determined by the Committee, which may  be used to measure the level of performance of the Company or  any individual Participant during a Performance Period, including  any Qualifying Performance Criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 2.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DEFINITIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As used in the Plan, the following terms shall have the meanings set  forth below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) Affiliate shall mean
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) any entity that, directly or through one  or more intermediaries, is controlled by the Company and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) any  entity in which the Company has a significant equity interest, as  determined by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (q) Performance Period shall mean any period as determined by the  Committee in its sole discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (r) Person shall mean any individual, corporation, partnership,  association, joint-stock company, trust, unincorporated  organization, or government or political subdivision thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) Award shall mean any Option, Stock Appreciation Right, Restricted  Stock, Restricted Stock Unit, Performance Award, Dividend  Equivalent, or Other Stock-Based Award granted under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (s) Qualifying Performance Criteria shall mean one or more of the  following performance criteria, either individually, alternatively or  in any combination, applied to either the Company as a whole or to  a business unit or related company, and measured either annually  or cumulatively over a period of years, on an absolute basis or  relative to a pre-established target, to a previous years results  or to a designated comparison group, in each case as specified by  the Committee in the Award: sales and revenue; income, earnings,  profit and margins; earnings per share; return on capital, return on  equity and return on investment; cash flow and cash returned to  investors; and total shareowner return, subject to adjustment by  the Committee to remove the effect of charges for restructurings,  discontinued operations and all items of gain, loss or expense  determined to be unusual in nature or infrequent in occurrence,  related to the disposal of a segment or a business, or related to a  change in accounting principle or otherwise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) Award Agreement shall mean any written agreement, contract,  or other instrument or document, including an electronic  communication, as may from time to time be designated by the  Company as evidencing any Award granted under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) Board shall mean the Board of Directors of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) Code shall mean the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended  from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) Committee shall mean a committee of the Board, acting in  accordance with the provisions of Section 3, designated by the  Board to administer the Plan and composed of not less than  three non-employee directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless otherwise determined by  the Board, the Management Development and Compensation  Committee of the Board generally serves as the Committee for  purposes of the Plan, except that the Governance and Public Affairs  Committee of the Board is responsible for administering the Plan  as it relates to any Award provided to a Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (t) Restricted Stock shall mean any award of Shares granted under Section 6(c) of the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (g) Director shall mean any member of the Board who is not a  Salaried Employee at the time of receiving an Award under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (u) Restricted Stock Unit shall mean any right granted under Section 6(c) of the Plan that is denominated in Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (h) Dividend Equivalent shall mean any right granted under Section  6(e) of the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) Salaried Employee shall mean any salaried employee of the  Company or of any Affiliate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) Fair Market Value shall mean, with respect to any Shares or other  securities, the closing price of a Share on the date as of which  the determination is being made or as otherwise determined in a  manner specified by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (w) Shares shall mean the common shares of the Company, $0.06  par value, and such other securities as may become the subject of  Awards, or become subject to Awards, pursuant to an adjustment  made under Section 4(b) of the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (j) Incentive Stock Option shall mean an option granted under  Section 6(a) of the Plan that is intended to meet the requirements  of Section 422 of the Code, or any successor provision thereto.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (x) Stock Appreciation Right shall mean any right granted under  Section 6(b) of the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

If an Award (other than a Dividend Equivalent) is  denominated in Shares, the number of Shares covered  by such Award, or to which such Award relates, shall be  counted on the date of grant of such Award against the  aggregate number of Shares available for granting Awards  under the Plan;

sentences.text: ADJUSTMENTS OF AWARDS UPON THE OCCURRENCE  OF CERTAIN UNUSUAL OR NONRECURRING EVENTS.

sentences.text: The  Committee shall be authorized to make adjustments in the  terms and conditions of, and the criteria included in, Awards  in recognition of unusual or nonrecurring events affecting  the Company, any Affiliate, or the financial statements of the  Company or any Affiliate, or of changes in applicable laws,  regulations, or accounting principles, whenever the Committee determines that such adjustments are appropriate in order to  prevent dilution or enlargement of the benefits or potential  benefits to be made available under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: iii.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SOURCES OF SHARES DELIVERABLE UNDER AWARDS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any  Shares delivered pursuant to an Award may consist, in whole or  in part, of authorized and unissued Shares or of treasury Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) ADJUSTMENTS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: i.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event that the Committee shall determine that any  dividend or other distribution (whether in the form of cash,  Shares, or other securities), recapitalization, stock split, reverse  stock split, reorganization, merger, consolidation, split-up, spin- off, combination, repurchase, or exchange of Shares or other  securities of the Company, issuance of warrants or other rights  to purchase Shares or other securities of the Company, or other  similar corporate transaction or event constitutes an equity  restructuring transaction, as that term is defined in Accounting  Standards Codification Topic 718 (or any successor thereto) or  otherwise affects the Shares, then the Committee shall adjust  the following in a manner that is determined by the Committee  to be appropriate in order to prevent dilution or enlargement of  the benefits or potential benefits intended to be made available  under the Plan:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 5.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ELIGIBILITY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any Salaried Employee, including any officer or employee-director  of the Company or of any Affiliate, or Director shall be eligible to be  designated a Participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 6.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AWARDS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) OPTIONS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is hereby authorized to grant Options to  Participants with the following terms and conditions and with such  additional terms and conditions, in either case not inconsistent  with the provisions of the Plan, as the Committee shall determine:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: i.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXERCISE PRICE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purchase price per Share purchasable  under an Option shall be determined by the Committee;  provided, however, and except as provided in Section 4(b), that  such purchase price shall not be less than 100% of the Fair  Market Value of a Share on the date of grant of such Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A. the number and type of Shares or other securities which  thereafter may be made the subject of Awards including  the limit specified in Section 4(a)(i) regarding the number of  shares that may be granted in the form of Restricted Stock,  Restricted Stock Units, Performance Awards, or Other  Stock-Based Awards;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ii.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OPTION TERM.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The term of each Option shall not exceed ten  (10) years from the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: iii.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TIME AND METHOD OF EXERCISE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall  establish in the applicable Award Agreement the time or times  at which an Option may be exercised in whole or in part, and the  method or methods by which, and the form or forms, including,  without limitation, cash, Shares, or other Awards, or any  combination thereof, having a Fair Market Value on the exercise  date equal to the relevant exercise price, in which payment of  the exercise price with respect thereto may be made or deemed  to have been made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: B. the number and type of Shares or other securities subject to outstanding Awards;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: C. the number and type of Shares or other securities specified  as the annual per-participant limitation under Section 6(g)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: D. the grant, purchase, or exercise price with respect to any  Award, or, if deemed appropriate, make provision for a cash payment to the holder of an outstanding Award; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: iv.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: INCENTIVE STOCK OPTIONS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms of any Incentive Stock  Option granted under the Plan shall be designed to comply in all  respects with the provisions of Section 422 of the Code, or any  successor provision thereto, and any regulations promulgated  thereunder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the avoidance of doubt, Incentive Stock Options  shall not be granted to Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding anything  in this Section 6(a) to the contrary, Options designated as  Incentive Stock Options shall not be eligible for treatment  under the Code as Incentive Stock Options (and will be deemed  to be Non-Qualified Stock Options) to the extent that either  (1) the aggregate Fair Market Value of Shares (determined  as of the time of grant) with respect to which such Options  are exercisable for the first time by the Participant during  any calendar year (under all plans of the Company and any  subsidiary) exceeds $100,000, taking Options into account  in the order in which they were granted, or (2) such Options  otherwise remain exercisable but are not exercised within three  (3) months of termination of employment (or such other period  of time provided in Section 422 of the Code).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: iii.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: REGISTRATION.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any Restricted Stock or Restricted Stock Units  granted under the Plan may be evidenced in such manner as  the Committee may deem appropriate, including, without  limitation, book-entry registration or issuance of a stock  certificate or certificates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event any stock certificate is  issued in respect of Shares of Restricted Stock granted under  the Plan, such certificate shall be registered in the name of  the Participant and shall bear an appropriate legend referring  to the terms, conditions, and restrictions applicable to such  Restricted Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: iv.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FORFEITURE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon termination of employment during the  applicable restriction period, except as determined otherwise  by the Committee, all Shares of Restricted Stock and all  Restricted Stock Units still, in either case, subject to restriction  shall be forfeited and reacquired by the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) PERFORMANCE AWARDS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is hereby authorized to  grant Performance Awards to Participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Awards  include arrangements under which the grant, issuance, retention,  exercisability, vesting and/or transferability of any Award is subject  to such Performance Criteria and such additional conditions or  terms as the Committee may designate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to the terms of the  Plan and any applicable Award Agreement, a Performance Award  granted under the Plan:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) STOCK APPRECIATION RIGHTS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is hereby  authorized to grant Stock Appreciation Rights to Participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to the terms of the Plan and any applicable Award  Agreement, a Stock Appreciation Right granted under the Plan  shall confer on the holder thereof a right to receive, upon exercise  thereof, the excess of (1) the Fair Market Value of one Share on the  date of exercise over (2) the grant price of the right as specified by  the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: i.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: may be denominated or payable in cash, Shares (including,  without limitation, Restricted Stock), other securities, or other  Awards; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: i.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GRANT PRICE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grant price per share of each Stock  Appreciation Right shall be determined by the Committee,  provided, however, and except as provided in Section 4(b), that  such price shall not be less than 100% of the Fair Market Value  of one Share on the date of grant of the Stock Appreciation  Right, except that if a Stock Appreciation Right is at any time  granted in tandem to an Option, the grant price of the Stock  Appreciation Right shall not be less than the exercise price of  such Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ii.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: shall confer on the holder thereof rights valued as determined  by the Committee and payable to, or exercisable by, the  holder of the Performance Award, in whole or in part, upon  the achievement of such performance goals during such  Performance Periods as the Committee shall establish.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) DIVIDEND EQUIVALENTS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is hereby authorized  to grant to Participants Awards (other than Options and Stock  Appreciation Rights) under which the holders thereof shall be  entitled to receive payments equivalent to dividends or interest  with respect to a number of Shares determined by the Committee,  and the Committee may provide that such amounts (if any) shall be  deemed to have been reinvested in additional Shares and paid out  only on and when Shares actually vest, are earned or are received  under such Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to the terms of the Plan and any  applicable Award Agreement, such Awards may have such terms  and conditions as the Committee shall determine.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ii.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TERM.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The term of each Stock Appreciation Right shall not  exceed ten (10) years from the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: iii.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TIME AND METHOD OF EXERCISE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall  establish in the applicable Award Agreement the time or times at which a Stock Appreciation Right may be exercised in whole  or in part.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) RESTRICTED STOCK AND RESTRICTED STOCK UNITS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) OTHER STOCK-BASED AWARDS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is hereby  authorized to grant to Participants such other Awards, including, but  not limited to, Deferred Stock Units, that are denominated or payable  in, valued in whole or in part by reference to, or otherwise based  on or related to, Shares (including, without limitation, securities  convertible into Shares), as are deemed by the Committee to be  consistent with the purposes of the Plan, provided, however, that  such grants must comply with applicable law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to the terms  of the Plan and any applicable Award Agreement, the Committee  shall determine the terms and conditions of such Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares  or other securities delivered pursuant to a purchase right granted  under this Section 6(f) shall be purchased for such consideration,  which may be paid by such method or methods and in such form or  forms, including, without limitation, cash, Shares, other securities,  or other Awards, or any combination thereof, as the Committee  shall determine, the value of which consideration, as established by  the Committee, and except as provided in Section 4(b), shall not be  less than the Fair Market Value of such Shares or other securities as  of the date such purchase right is granted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: i.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ISSUANCE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is hereby authorized to grant Awards of Restricted Stock and Restricted Stock Units  to Participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ii.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESTRICTIONS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards of Restricted Stock and Restricted  Stock Units shall be subject to such restrictions as the  Committee may establish in the applicable Award Agreement  (including, without limitation, any limitation on the right  to vote a Share of Restricted Stock or the right to receive  any dividend or other right), which restrictions may lapse  separately or in combination at such time or times, in such  installments or otherwise, as the Committee may deem  appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unrestricted Shares, evidenced in such manner  as the Committee shall deem appropriate, shall be delivered to  the holder of Restricted Stock promptly after such restrictions  have lapsed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GE 2017 Proxy Statement Appendix A
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (g) GENERAL.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: purposes) and (B) any cash or other compensation that is not  equity-based and that is paid by the Company with respect to  the Directors service as a Director for any fiscal year may not  exceed $1,500,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may make exceptions to  the foregoing limit for a Director or committee of Directors, as it  may determine in its discretion, provided that (C) the aggregate  dollar value of any such additional compensation may not  exceed $1,000,000 for the fiscal year and (D) the Director  receiving such additional compensation does not participate in  the decision to award such compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: i.

sentences.text: NO CASH CONSIDERATION FOR AWARDS.

sentences.text: Awards shall be granted for no cash consideration or for such minimal cash consideration as may be required by applicable law.

sentences.text: ii.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AWARDS MAY BE GRANTED SEPARATELY OR TOGETHER.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards may, in the discretion of the Committee, be granted  either alone or in addition to, in tandem with, or in substitution  for any other Award or any award granted under any other plan  of the Company or any Affiliate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards granted in addition to  or in tandem with other Awards, or in addition to or in tandem  with awards granted under any other plan of the Company or  any Affiliate, may be granted either at the same time as or at a  different time from the grant of such other Awards or awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: vii.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CONDITIONS AND RESTRICTIONS UPON SECURITIES SUBJECT  TO AWARDS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may provide that the Shares  issued upon exercise of an Option or Stock Appreciation Right  or otherwise subject to or issued under an Award shall be  subject to such further agreements, restrictions, conditions  or limitations as the Committee in its discretion may specify  prior to the exercise of such Option or Stock Appreciation Right  or the grant, vesting or settlement of such Award, including  without limitation, conditions on vesting or transferability and  forfeiture or repurchase provisions or provisions on payment of  taxes arising in connection with an Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Without limiting the  foregoing, such restrictions may address the timing and manner  of any resales by the Participant or other subsequent transfers  by the Participant of any Shares issued under an Award,  including without limitation: (A) restrictions under an insider  trading policy or pursuant to applicable law, (B) restrictions  designed to delay and/or coordinate the timing and manner  of sales by Participant and holders of other Company equity  compensation arrangements, (C) restrictions as to the use of  a specified brokerage firm for such resales or other transfers  and (D) provisions requiring Shares to be sold on the open  market or to the Company in order to satisfy tax withholding or  other obligations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: iii.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FORMS OF PAYMENT UNDER AWARDS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to the terms of  the Plan and of any applicable Award Agreement, payments or  transfers to be made by the Company or an Affiliate upon the  grant, exercise, or payment of an Award may be made in such  form or forms as the Committee shall determine, including,  without limitation, cash, Shares, rights in or to Shares issuable  under the Award or other Awards, other securities, or other  Awards, or any combination thereof, and may be made in a  single payment or transfer, in installments, or on a deferred  basis, in each case in accordance with rules and procedures  established by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such rules and procedures  may include, without limitation, provisions for the payment  or crediting of reasonable interest on installment or deferred  payments or the grant or crediting of Dividend Equivalents in  respect of installment or deferred payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: iv.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LIMITS ON TRANSFER OF AWARDS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except as provided by the  Committee, no Award and no right under any such Award,  shall be assignable, alienable, saleable, or transferable by a  Participant otherwise than by will or by the laws of descent and  distribution provided, however, that, if so determined by the  Committee, a Participant may, in the manner established by the  Committee, designate a beneficiary or beneficiaries to exercise  the rights of the Participant with respect to any Award upon the  death of the Participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Award, and each right under any  Award, shall be exercisable, during the Participants lifetime,  only by the Participant or, if permissible under applicable law,  by the Participants guardian or legal representative.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Award  and no right under any such Award, may be pledged, alienated,  attached, or otherwise encumbered, and any purported pledge,  alienation, attachment, or encumbrance thereof shall be void  and unenforceable against the Company or any Affiliate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: viii.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SHARE CERTIFICATES.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Shares or other securities delivered  under the Plan pursuant to any Award or the exercise thereof  shall be subject to such stop transfer orders and other  restrictions as the Committee may deem advisable under the  Plan or the rules, regulations, and other requirements of the  Securities and Exchange Commission, any stock exchange  upon which such Shares or other securities are then listed,  and any applicable Federal, state, or local securities laws,  and the Committee may cause a legend or legends to be put  on any such certificates to make appropriate reference to  such restrictions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ix.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NO REPRICING.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except in connection with a corporate  transaction or adjustment described in Section 4(b) of the Plan,  the terms of outstanding Options, Stock Appreciation Rights  or other Stock-Based Awards encompassing rights to purchase  Shares that have an exercise or purchase price in excess of the  Fair Market Value of a Share may not be amended to reduce  the exercise or purchase price of such Awards, and any such  outstanding Options, Stock Appreciation Rights or other Stock- Based Awards encompassing rights to purchase Shares may not  be exchanged for cash or property, other Awards, or Options,  Stock Appreciation Rights or other Stock-Based Awards  encompassing rights to purchase Shares with an exercise  or purchase price that is less than the exercise or purchase  price of the original Awards, in each case unless approved  by shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: v. PER-PERSON LIMITATION ON OPTIONS AND SARs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number  of Shares with respect to which Options and Stock Appreciation Rights may be granted under the Plan during any three-year  period to an individual Participant shall not exceed 9,000,000  Shares, subject to adjustment as provided in Section 4(b).

sentences.text: The Plan will be administered in compliance  with Section 10D of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as  amended, any applicable rules or regulations promulgated by the  Securities and Exchange Commission or any national securities  exchange or national securities association on which the Shares  may be traded, and any Company policy adopted with respect  to compensation recoupment.
